page.lettertext:
fol.65v
Belgia 1591 sti
l
Ro
m
8 Fe
b
To M
r
Bodly
S
r
, uppon
my
arryvall heer findinge the winde good to
carry me into
Englande,
and consideringe howe greatly my beeynge
ther may importe the fartherance of her
Ma
ts
service, havinge been
advertised what expedition the same requirethe by reason of the
dangerous tearmes I understande
Brittany
nowe to stande in, I
thoughte good w
th
all speed to Shipp my self awaye, prayinge
yo
w
to yealde yo
r
best help and assistance unto the fartherance
of thes services, and to give me notice of soche advertismentes as
yo
w
shall recieve to thend that at my beynge in Englande I may ther
after the better use meanes to provide for thes countreys, Capten
Anthony Wingfielde
shall have occasion to stay heer behinde
me to whome yf yo
w
send what l
res
your self cannot otherwise
conveniently convey into Englande unto me, he will use meanes
to send them,
and even so leavinge I c
o
myt yo
w
to the keepeinge of
god. Vlishinge this viijth of February 1590./
Your assured frend John Norreys.
